Obligation:2 "Risk Management Framework**: Develop and integrate strategies within your overall risk management framework to manage and mitigate identified climate-related risks."

Obligation:3 "Scenario Analysis and Stress Testing**: Conduct scenario analyses and stress tests to understand the potential impact of climate-related risks on your business under various future scenarios."

Obligation:4 "Disclosure**: Enhance transparency by disclosing climate-related risks in line with international frameworks such as the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) and any applicable reporting standards or guidelines."

Obligation:5 "Governance**: Ensure that governance structures are in place to adequately address climate-related risks, with clear roles and responsibilities for oversight and management, and that the board and senior management are actively involved."
Obligation:6 "Regulatory Reporting**: Comply with any reporting requirements related to climate risks as mandated by ADGM or other relevant authorities."
Obligation:7 "Stakeholder Engagement**: Engage with stakeholders, including investors, clients, and regulators, on climate-related risks and your approach to managing them."
Obligation:8 "Strategic Planning**: Incorporate climate-related risks and opportunities into your strategic planning and business strategy."
Obligation:9 "Training and Awareness**: Provide training to relevant staff to understand climate-related risks and the impact on the business."

Obligation:10 "Review ADGM Regulations**: Regularly review ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) publications and guidelines, and consult the latest ADGM financial regulations and any guidance notes or circulars that pertain to climate-related risks and ESG factors."
Obligation:11 "Seek Professional Advice**: If necessary, seek advice from compliance professionals or legal advisors who specialize in ADGM regulatory matters to ensure compliance."
Obligation:12 "Stay Informed**: Stay informed about any new regulations or amendments to existing regulations related to climate change and sustainable finance."
